page.title: 10THE GLAMIS LANDSCAPE
page.content:
The area around Glamis and Charleston lies on the southern edge of Strathmore - the Big Valley. The lower slopes of the Sidlaws form the majority of the area, and the valley bottom forms the northern fringe.
The Sidlaws are a range of hills reaching to 450 meters, but only reaching 285 meters in our area. This hilly ground is partly forested, mainly with coniferous woodland, partly rough grazing, and partly productive farm land.
The valley of Strathmore is a large glacial outwash plain. This low ground (height about 80 meters) is very rich farm land. Some of the fields are still edged with mature deciduous trees, which give an attractive character to the area.
